{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3312817,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T08:12:05.078Z","cooked":"
GitHub

Release WPILib 2024.3.1 Release ¬∑ wpilibsuite/allwpilib

This is an update release of WPILib for the 2024 season. This release has a number of quality-of-life bugfixes. Upgrading from earlier 2024 releases is easy: simply download and run the new install...

This is an update release of WPILib for the 2024 season. This release has a number of quality-of-life bugfixes.

Upgrading from earlier 2024 releases is easy: simply download and run the new installer and it will update your current installation. If you already have the 2024 WPILib vscode installed, it will detect it and you can simply click ‚Äúnext‚Äù for that installation step. After installation, vscode will prompt you when opening your robot project whether you want to upgrade it to this version. Note that using the installer is required to get the new version of desktop tools such as Shuffleboard. This release is compatible with the kickoff release of the RoboRIO image, so there is no need to upgrade the RIO image if you have already done so for 2024. Mac note: if upgrading from 2024.1.1, it is necessary to manually remove the 2024.1.1 version of AdvantageScope before running the installer in order for the new version to be installed.

The documentation for WPILib is located at https://docs.wpilib.org/ (if you have trouble accessing this location, FIRST Robotics Competition Control System ‚Äî FIRST Robotics Competition documentation is an alternate location with the same content).

If you‚Äôre new to FRC, start with Getting Started.

A complete list of known issues with this release can be found here.

WPILib is developed by a small team of volunteers and the FIRST community.

What‚Äôs Changed since 2024.2.1

NetworkTables

  • StructArrayPublisher: Publish schema in span-taking setters by PeterJohnson
  • Don‚Äôt send value update to client setting value (optimization) by PeterJohnson
  • Add hidden subscribe option by PeterJohnson

SysId

  • Fix SSTO calculation by calcmogul
  • Relax peak acceleration search by Oblarg
  • SysIdRoutine: Reset timer in quasistatic test by ArchdukeTim
  • SysIdRoutineLog: Initialize m_stateInitialized by Kython89
  • Add angular subsystem to SysIdRoutine example by DeltaDizzy

Math

  • Clean up profile classes by calcmogul
  • Make Rotation2d implicitly convert from any angle unit by calcmogul
  • Remove duplicate calls to norm() in Quaternion::Log() by ThadHouse
  • Add lastValue() method to filters by N0tACyb0rg
  • Add vector projection and geometry vector conversions by AngleSideAngle
  • Use correct ‚Äòk‚Äô value when negative ka is provided in Feed Forward by fodfodfod
  • ExponentialProfile: Return copies of the current and goal states by shueja

Glass / Simulation GUI

  • Update field size defaults in Field2D by gerth2
  • Fix FMS game data editing by PeterJohnson

Java Units

  • Add singularized aliases for built in units by SamCarlberg
  • Fix measure isNear function by vichik123

Commands

  • Fix incorrect ordering of parameters in TrapezoidProfileSubsystem by rzblue

Shuffleboard

  • Improve NT behavior by PeterJohnson

Examples

  • Move triggers to subsystem fields by DeltaDizzy
  • Fix memory leak in C++ controller command examples by KangarooKoala
  • Don‚Äôt reset encoders when resetting odometry by rzblue

WPILib

  • Add methods for reading individual RGB values from LED buffers by SamCarlberg
  • Remove unusable std::unique_ptr case for SendableChooser by KangarooKoala
  • Const-qualify SendableChooser.GetSelected() by KangarooKoala

AprilTag

  • Fix field length in 2024 JSON by calcmogul
  • Add AprilTagFieldLayout.loadField() and migrate to it by KangarooKoala

HAL

  • Error out of HAL_Initialize if SetupRioNow fails by ThadHouse
  • HAL_RefreshDSData: Zero out control word on DS disconnected, Use cache in sim by ThadHouse

Installer

  • Disable CLI args for AdvantageScope on Windows by jwbonner
  • Enable vscode system HTTP certificates by spacey-sooty
  • Update AdvantageScope to 3.2.0 by jwbonner

New Contributors

  • ArchdukeTim made their first contribution
  • vichik123 made their first contribution
  • Kython89 made their first contribution
  • N0tACyb0rg made their first contribution
  • fodfodfod made their first contribution
  • JoeWildfong made their first contribution

CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":27}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":27,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3313174,"name":"","username":"C3434","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/ee59a6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T22:25:11.364Z","cooked":"

This release is compatible with the kickoff release of the RoboRIO image

We downloaded the latest version, and we could not deploy our code to our robot. The error message that we get is
RoboRIO and GradleRIO versions are incompatible:
Current image version: 2024_v1.1
GradleRIO-compatible image versions: 2024_v2.*

As far as we could find, there is no RIO image of a higher version than 1.1, are we doing anything wrong?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T22:25:22.459Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":409,"readers_count":408,"score":96.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56160,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313178,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T22:30:42.265Z","cooked":"
C3434:

As far as we could find, there is no RIO image of a higher version than 1.1, are we doing anything wrong?

2024v1.1 was a beta image. Were you running the beta version of WPILib as well? The image version requirement has not changed since the kickoff release. You need to install the latest NI Game Tools to get the 2.x image. The kickoff release of the NI Game Tools unfortunately did not correctly install over the beta release (requring a deinstall), but I believe the more recent NI update release fixed that.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T22:38:21.454Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":392,"readers_count":391,"score":88.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/3","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313185,"name":"","username":"CYO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T22:43:19.879Z","cooked":"
Peter_Johnson:

Upgrading from earlier 2024 releases is easy: simply download and run the new installer and it will update your current installation. If you already have the 2024 WPILib vscode installed, it will detect it and you can simply click ‚Äúnext‚Äù for that installation step. After installation, vscode will prompt you when opening your robot project whether you want to upgrade it to this version. Note that using the installer is required to get the new version of desktop tools such as Shuffleboard.

If I only care about updating for code and not the desktop tools, do I still need to download and install the new installer? Or is it okay to just change the version in build.gradle?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T22:43:19.879Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":360,"readers_count":359,"score":82.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40508,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313196,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T22:55:37.472Z","cooked":"

You can just update the version in build.gradle if you only want to upgrade robot code. However, not using the installer means you won‚Äôt have local copies of the Maven artifacts, so at the very least you‚Äôll need to do a build when connected to the internet so the artifacts can be downloaded. One benefit of the installer is it installs all Maven dependencies locally in one shot.

Is there a reason you don‚Äôt want to upgrade the desktop tools? Note Shuffleboard and Glass both benefit from the NT updates, and some of the updates are specific to SysId.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T22:57:19.020Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":332,"readers_count":331,"score":81.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":40508,"username":"CYO","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a88e4f/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/5","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313223,"name":"","username":"CYO","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-19T23:18:54.829Z","cooked":"
Peter_Johnson:

Is there a reason you don‚Äôt want to upgrade the desktop tools? Note Shuffleboard and Glass both benefit from the NT updates, and some of the updates are specific to SysId.

It‚Äôs a logistical challenge to ensure everyone on the team has upgraded with the latest installer. Much easier to have people pull code and just have it work.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-19T23:18:54.829Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":78.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":40508,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313264,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T00:19:17.936Z","cooked":"

From an inspection perspective is 2.1 expected to be the minimum for events or will teams need to be on 2024.3.1 to pass inspection?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T00:19:17.936Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":284,"readers_count":283,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Doug Frisk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22789,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/7","custom_user_title":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313266,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T00:21:02.930Z","cooked":"

There are no rules (and thus no inspection requirements) for WPILib. Only requirement is a legal 2024 roboRIO image, which implies any 2024 WPILib release.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T00:21:38.694Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":287,"readers_count":286,"score":97.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22789,"username":"Doug_Frisk","name":"Doug Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313270,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T00:29:09.333Z","cooked":"

The inspection checklist currently states 2.1 or later on the RoboRIO. In the past that has changed after kickoff. I‚Äôm wondering if that‚Äôs likely to change prior to the week one events this year. If it does, there are 109 teams I‚Äôd like to inform.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T00:29:09.333Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":291,"readers_count":290,"score":73.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Doug Frisk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65,"username":"Joe_Ross","name":"Joe Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22789,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/9","custom_user_title":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313286,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T01:05:50.978Z","cooked":"

There‚Äôs no roboRIO image 2024.3.1. 2024_v2.2 is the latest version and it was released several weeks ago and wasn‚Äôt made required then so it seems unlikely that it would be made required in tomorrow‚Äôs update, the last one before ISR 1

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-20T01:10:33.565Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Joe Ross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":22789,"username":"Doug_Frisk","name":"Doug Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":65,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3313505,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-20T05:47:07.328Z","cooked":"
Joe_Ross:

the last one before ISR 1

Except the one on Friday (ISR 1 only starts on Sunday).

Hello. I‚Äôm getting constant memory leaks on a roboRIO 1. I‚Äôm not doing any vision processing or heavy computing on it. I‚Äôm not doing any logging, only SysID. I‚Äôm using AdvantageKit but only updating values over NetworkTables. The roboRIO is on the latest firmware. I was facing memory leaks on WPILib version 2024.2.1 but it has gone worse since switching to 2024.3.1. Any potential reasons and ways to fix it? Thank you.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":19,"updated_at":"2024-02-22T22:41:52.503Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":455295,"topic_slug":"wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release","display_username":"Jainish Patel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54172,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-2024-3-1-update-release/455295/14","custom_user_title":"4065 NOP | Programming Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3315541,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-22T23:44:10.956Z","cooked":"
JaiCodes:

it has gone worse since switching to 2024.3.1

There aren‚Äôt that many changes between 2.1 and 3.1. The only change to 3.1 that jumps out at me as increasing GC pressure is the ExponentialProfile change, which now returns a new object instead of an existing object. If your code runs better with 2.1 for whatever reason, feel free to stick with it; 3.1 is not a required update.

Are you really talking about memory leaks or just running out of memory (which can be caused by increased object allocation of any kind in Java)? One thing to try would be to free up some memory by disabling the Rio system webserver via the WPILib RoboRIO Team Number Setter tool.

Running out of memory. I‚Äôm creating more objects than usual since I‚Äôm using AdvantageKit. I know the docs talk about the Java Garbage Collector and the intention to reduce object creation. Is there a way that I can see how many objects are too much?

We don‚Äôt have a good way to estimate that, unfortunately. The JVM is just too opaque. In addition to freeing up system memory, memory fragmentation might be a cause. See this thread for more discussion: Consistent insufficient memory error - #6 by Peter_Johnson
